newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ericsson, Saab defence j/v eyes growth.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson, Saab defence j/v eyes growth.

text.p: Swedish telecoms firm LM Ericsson AB said on Thursday that the joint defence venture with Saab Aircraft, announced on Thursday, would strengthen their position in the world defence industry.
Ericsson said earlier its Ericsson Microwave Systems AB division would form a joint venture, called Ericsson Saab Avionics AB, with Saab Aircraft on military aircraft technology.
"The formation of Ericsson Saab Avionics signifies the concentration of a number of key areas for future defence systems," said Ericsson Microwave Systems president Jan-Ake Kark in a statement.
"This means enhanced possibilities for exports and development of our operations."
The new venture would incorporate Ericsson Microwave Systems operations, the Saab Dynamics equipment division and the Saab Military Aircraft unit, Ericsson said in a statement.
The merger of complementary activities in Saab and Ericsson would "strengthen the companies' positions while structuring the Swedish defence industry in strategically important areas," Ericsson said.
Ericsson Saab Avionics, which would be consolidated into the Ericsson group, would concentrate on electronic warfare, display and surveillance systems and electromagnetic technology, it said.

"We will strengthen the positions of both Saab and Ericsson in the electronic warfare and MMI (Man-Machine Interface) fields," said Bjorn Erman, the newly appointed president of Ericsson Saab Avionics, in a statement.
Erman was previously director of Ericsson Microwave Systems.
Several of the new company's products would be used in the Saab-manufactured fighter jet, the JAS 39 Gripen.
Saab and Ericsson will own equal shares in the company, but Ericsson will hold the final vote.
